Posts.Content: almost30 wrote: Hi...  this may be a stupid question but I've been innundated with conflicting information.  I found a small lump in my breast a few days ago, I have no insurance having as I've recently returned to the US after several years away (not that it's very likely I would have had insurance anyway, realistically).  Several people have told me to try and find some sort of coverage before I even go see a doctor, because if it were to be diagnosed as cancerous I'd become immediately uninsurable.  However, this takes time of course and money's an issue.  Does anyone have any experience with this?  I live in New Jersey at the moment but work in New York and have been planning to move to NY in August.  There are enough resources in NYC that I'm sure I could find reasonable clinic care to get it checked out, but I'm just worried about signing up for a lifetime of debt if I don't have insurance first.....  any thoughts would be so appreciated! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Diagnosis before insurance.. bad idea? almost30 Sandy1941
